sentence: Farmers in the area grow a wide range of crops but major crops include wheat, barley, and horse beans.
sentence_gap: Farmers in the area grow a wide range of crops but major crops include wheat, ______, and horse beans.

explanation: next to or touching another, usually similar, thing
in very bad condition because of being old, or not having been cared for, or having been used a lot
sentence: A decrepit old man sat on a park bench.
sentence_gap: A ________ old man sat on a park bench.

explanation: to change direction or make something change direction, especially after hitting something
sentence: The ball deflected off my shoulder, straight into the goal.
sentence_gap: The ball _________ off my shoulder, straight into the goal.

explanation: to say or pronounce words clearly; (formal) to express an idea clearly and exactly
sentence: She enunciated each word slowly and carefully. He enunciated his vision of the future.
sentence_gap: She __________ each word slowly and carefully. He __________ his vision of the future.

explanation: to have a lot of a particular quality or feeling; to produce a smell or liquid substance from inside
sentence: She just exudes confidence. Some trees exude a sap that repels insect parasites.
sentence_gap: She just _____s confidence. Some trees _____ a sap that repels insect parasites.

explanation: formal; a guess that you make or an opinion that you form based on the information that you have
sentence: They were warned to expect a heavy air attack and by inference many casualties.
sentence_gap: They were warned to expect a heavy air attack and by _________ many casualties.

explanation: to flow slowly out of something through a small opening, or to slowly produce a thick sticky liquid
sentence: Blood was still oozing out of the wound.
sentence_gap: Blood was still ______ out of the wound.

explanation: (of a place) quiet and private; not used or disturbed by other people
sentence: At the restaurant, he led her to a secluded booth and waited until she was seated.
sentence_gap: At the restaurant, he led her to a ________ booth and waited until she was seated.

explanation: only present in small amounts or numbers and often spread over a large area
sentence: Vegetation becomes sparse higher up the mountains.
sentence_gap: Vegetation becomes ______ higher up the mountains.

explanation: the main stem of a plant, or the narrow stem that joins leaves, flowers, or fruit to the main stem of a plant
sentence: She trimmed the stalks of the tulips before putting them in a vase.
sentence_gap: She trimmed the ______ of the tulips before putting them in a vase.

explanation: a white substance that exists in large amounts in potatoes and particular grains such as rice
sentence: Corn starch is used as a thickener in stews.
sentence_gap: Corn ______ is used as a thickener in stews.

sentence: Today, some two hundred million starlings and a further one hundred and fifty million sparrows live there.
sentence_gap: Today, some two hundred million _________ and a further one hundred and fifty million sparrows live there.

explanation: a flat structure covered with cloth which is used to carry someone who is sick or injured
sentence: She was carried off the track on a stretcher.
sentence_gap: She was carried off the track on a _________.

explanation: to advertise, talk about, or praise something or someone repeatedly, especially as a way of encouraging people to like, accept, or buy something
sentence: He is being widely touted as the next leader of the party.
sentence_gap: He is being widely ______ as the next leader of the party.
